abstract: Whether or not the world needed another profile of Carl Icahn (who, depending on the era, is variously described as a “financier,” a “corporate raider” or an “activist investor”), Fortune magazine has a long one in its latest issue. The general thesis is that although the “New Icahn” may be different from the old one, his, ahem, expansive personality hasn’t changed that much through the years.
lead_paragraph: Whether or not the world needed another profile of Carl Icahn (who, depending on the era, is variously described as a “financier,” a “corporate raider” or an “activist investor”), Fortune magazine has a long one in its latest issue. The general thesis is that although the “New Icahn” may be different from the old one, his, ahem, expansive personality hasn’t changed that much through the years.
